alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:58AM CDT until May 17 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. For the Navidad River...including Morales...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding occurs as water inundates County Road 283. Livestock could be cut off and should be removed from the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 29.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 29.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 11.3 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.5 feet on 10/06/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Navidad River Morales 29.0 29.6 Tue 8 am CDT 20.4 14.5 12.3 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
